title: How to Choose a God (or Gods)

steps.headline: Learn about the many different religions which are out there, and about what their beliefs in God or gods are.
Ask yourself, what exactly are you seeking spiritually.
Read the different Scriptures of various religions.
steps.description: Example: The Bible, the Quran, the Vedas, the I Ching, etc.

steps.headline: Are you seeking a God which will help you with your relationship with nature?
steps.description: or with your fellow human beings? Or perhaps both...?

steps.headline: Learn the different stories which are associated with God or gods, in order to narrow down your choice.
Learn about the different kinds of evil entities, which different religions are trying to oppose, in order to narrow down your choice.
steps.description: (Example: if you wish to oppose satanic evil, then most likely the God of Christianity or Islam is the one you wish to worship; or if its the delusions of the Mara, then it is most likely the Buddha whom you wish to follow).

steps.headline: Think about which virtues are most important to you.
Visit different churches, mosques, temples, etc., in order to learn the way in which God or gods are worshipped by different religions.
